org.bhave.network.impl.hash.dynamic

Class DynamicHashNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bhave.network.impl.hash.dynamic.DynamicHashNetwork
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DynamicNetwork, Network

    public class DynamicHashNetwork
extends java.lang.Object
implements DynamicNetwork
    Implementation of dynamic network. This is a simple implementation which wraps around multiple instances of Network objects. Each of these instances represent a moment in time in which nodes or links were added.
    Author:
    Davide Nunes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DynamicHashNetwork()
      Constructor Starts with a dynamic network with an initial time instant of 0, this represents an initial state of the network.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DynamicHashNetwork

        @Inject
public DynamicHashNetwork()
        Constructor Starts with a dynamic network with an initial time instant of 0, this represents an initial state of the network. If you don't use a @{link setTime operation, this network works exactly like a normal network would.

      • addLink

        public Link addLink(Node node1,
           Node node2)
        Description copied from interface: Network
        Adds a Link to the graph. Fails if the Link is already in the Network, if the nodes do not exist in the network or if any of these elements is null.

        Note: the network is both directed and undirected by default. What this means is that if you wish to work with a directed network, the order of the given nodes dictates the direction of the link. If you wish to work with an undirected network, the order is not important, just use the methods that do not take link direction in consideration.
        Specified by:
        addLink in interface Network
        Parameters:
        node1 - an existing node within the network
        node2 - an existing node within the network
        Returns:
        link a link if add is successful, null otherwise

      • addLink

        public boolean addLink(Node node1,
              Node node2,
              Link link)
        Description copied from interface: Network
        Creates and adds a link to the network between the given nodes. Fails if the nodes do not exist in the network or if any of them is null.

        Note: the network is both directed and undirected by default. What this means is that if you wish to work with a directed network, the order of the given nodes dictates the direction of the link. If you wish to work with an undirected network, the order is not important, just use the methods that do not take link direction in consideration.
        Specified by:
        addLink in interface Network
        Parameters:
        node1 - an existing node within the network
        node2 - an existing node within the network
        link - a link to be added from node1 to node2
        Returns:
        true if add is successful, false otherwise
